decks.name: Rendering in React
decks.description: React's component structure allows for quickly building a complex web application that relies on DOM manipulation.

decks.name: React Router
decks.description: React Router is a collection of navigational components that compose declaratively with your application.

decks.name: Testing
decks.description: Will be used for testing this app

decks.name: React Hooks
decks.description: React Hooks are a new addition in React 16.8. They let you use state and other React features without writing a class.

decks.name: React Context
decks.description: Context provides a way to pass data through the component tree without having to pass props down manually at every level.

decks.name: React Forms
decks.description: Forms are essential for controlling user input, gathering information to submit to a server, and setting up basic interactivity with a website.

decks.name: React State
decks.description: State is the heart of React. It allows you to create components that manage their own data, respond to user input, and hold complex UIs.

decks.name: React Props
decks.description: Props are how components talk to each other. They are passed to components via HTML attributes.

decks.name: React Components
decks.description: Components are the core building block of React. They are like JavaScript functions that return React elements.

decks.name: React
decks.description: React is a declarative, efficient, and flexible JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

cards.front: How do you modify the state of a different React component?
cards.back: Not at all! State is visible to the component only.

cards.front: How do you pass data 'down' to a React child component?
